Functions package

Submodules

Functions.distances module

This module contains a function to calculate the distance between two points on the earth’s surface given their latitude and longitude in degrees.

Functions.distances.distance(lat1: float, lon1: float, lat2: float, lon2: float) → float

Calculate the distance between two points on the earth’s surface given their latitude and longitude in degrees.

Parameters:

  • lat1 (float) – Latitude of the first point in degrees.

  • lon1 (float) – Longitude of the first point in degrees.

  • lat2 (float) – Latitude of the second point in degrees.

  • lon2 (float) – Longitude of the second point in degrees.

Returns:

The distance between the two points in kilometers.

Return type:

float

Example

distance(55.751244, 37.618423, 59.93863, 30.31413) 634.0

Functions.download_zip module

This module contains a function that downloads a file of your choice

Functions.download_zip.download_file(file_link: str, output_file: str = 'downloads/flight_data.zip') → None

Downloads a file from an URL into your hard drive.

Parameters:

  • file_link (str) – A string containing the link to the file you wish to download.

  • output_file (str) – A string containing the name of the output file. The default value is ‘file.csv’ at the location you are running the function.

Return type:

Nothing

Example

download_file(”https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/00320/student.zip”,

output_file=’student.zip’)

Functions.reading_zip module

This module contains a function that unzips a zip-file of your choice

Functions.reading_zip.unzip(target_file: str) → dict

Unzips a file from an URL into your hard drive.

Parameters:

target_file (str) – A string containing the name of the file you wish to unzip.

Return type:

All csv files in the zip file in the form of a dictionary.
